entry.title: G. E. Clements (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during World War II, pilot G. E. Clements (pictured) was removed from training for secret missions associated with the Manhattan Project when senior officers realized she was a woman?

entry.title: Gansen-ji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Japanese Buddhist temple of Gansen-ji has a 275-centimeter-tall (9.02 ft) statue of Amitābha Buddha that was created in the year 946?

entry.title: Astrid Lindgren (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Astrid Lindgren can be read in 100 languages?

entry.title: an underground hip hop album (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an underground hip hop album was funded by James Murdoch, the son of billionaire Rupert Murdoch?

entry.title: Dick Linthicum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that prior to his career in the CIA, Dick Linthicum played basketball at UCLA and became the university's first All-American in any sport?

entry.title: ROG Ally (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that three days after announcing their ROG Ally handheld computer, Asus had to clarify that it was not an April Fools' prank?

entry.title: Precious Brady-Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Precious Brady-Davis and her husband were the first transgender couple to have their gender identities listed correctly on an Illinois birth certificate?

entry.title: sinking of the Costa Concordia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the sinking of the Costa Concordia, Gregorio de Falco told Francesco Schettino "Vada a bordo, cazzo!" which loosely translates to "Get back on board, for fuck's sake"?
